channel.title: Machinelearning on Mr. Pointing
channel.description: Recent content in Machinelearning on Mr. Pointing

item.title: Deep Learning - Chapter 2
item.description: Linear Algebra This book covers all topics of linear algebra that are important to deep learning, not necessarily all topics within Linear Algebra. For a text more focused in linear algebra, see here. Scalars, Vectors, Matrices, and Tensors Scalars Single numbers, usually denoted by a lowercase variable name, and introduced with some information on the number. Ex. Let $s \in R$ be the slope of the line for a real-valued scalar Let $n \in N$ be the number of units for a natural number scalar Vectors An ordered array of numbers, obtainable via the index position of the number in the array.

item.title: Deep Learning - Preface
item.description: Preface MIT Press Online Edition Ian Goodfellow, Yoshua Bengio, and Aaron Courville Link to the book. Chapter 1 Introduction This book is intended to prepare you for concepts and theory used in Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence, more specifically deep learning, or the multi-layered stacked concepts that make up the intelligence of an AI model. Like most textbooks, it goes into the why of AI, and what they do best; solving problems that humans are generally not good at.

item.title: AI Engineer Roadmap
item.description: A resource by Code Basics We’ll see how this works. Starting in June of 2024, I plan to get myself prepared for a new career after another year of teaching. Pretty much; I want to find a job ideally that starts in the late summer of next year. Week 0 is stupid lol. Week 1 and 2 (6/2 - 6/17) I have a masters degree in this subject. I think I can handle a khan academy course and going through the entire Python documentation in two weeks.
